title: EXAMPLE: Open Investigations and Employee Privacy
summary: [EXAMPLE DATA] Supreme Court ruling in Predisik v. Spokane School District clarifies that public records revealing ongoing investigations (but not specific allegations) are not exempt from disclosure under employee privacy protections.
compressed_content:
• [EXAMPLE] Supreme Court decision in Predisik v. Spokane School District No. 81
• [EXAMPLE] Public records showing investigation status (not allegations) must be disclosed
• [EXAMPLE] RCW 42.56.230(3) privacy exemption does not apply to investigation existence
• [EXAMPLE] Administrative leave letters and payroll records subject to disclosure
• [EXAMPLE] Distinguished from Bellevue John Does case on unsubstantiated allegations
• [EXAMPLE] No 'highly offensive' standard met for investigation status disclosure
search_text: EXAMPLE Predisik Spokane School District Public Records Act RCW 42.56.230 employee privacy administrative leave investigations disclosure exemptions Bellevue John Does highly offensive standard
